{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Experienced Transport and Logistics Manager",
  "description": "Gbekemo Farms Limited - Established with a vision to revolutionize agriculture and FMCG (Fast-Moving Consumer Goods) industries, Gbekemo Farms Limited is a leading player in Nigeria&#39;s agribusiness landscape. The company has emerged as a beacon of innovation and sustainability, committed to enhancing food security andeconomic growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Experienced&nbsp;Transport and Logistics Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage and coordinate transport and logistics operations.
	Develop and implement efficient strategies for fleet management, warehousing, and distribution.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and safety procedures.
	Supervise staff, monitor performance, and provide leadership for operational excellence.
	Drive cost efficiency while maintaining quality service delivery.
	Foster strong relationships with clients, partners, and vendors.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or related field.
	Strong leadership, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent knowledge of transport regulations, logistics software, and industry best practices.
	Ability to work under pressure and deliver results.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;antoni.hadesina@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application &ndash; Experienced Transport and Logistics Manager&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-02",

  },

Experienced Transport and Logistics Manager Job at Gbekemo Farms Limited




        
    

        
        Gbekemo Farms Limited - Established with a vision to revolutionize agriculture and FMCG (Fast-Moving Consumer Goods) industries, Gbekemo Farms Limited is a leading player in Nigeria's agribusiness landscape. The company has emerged as a beacon of innovation and sustainability, committed to enhancing food security andeconomic growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Experienced Transport and Logistics Manager
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage and coordinate transport and logistics operations.
	Develop and implement efficient strategies for fleet management, warehousing, and distribution.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and safety procedures.
	Supervise staff, monitor performance, and provide leadership for operational excellence.
	Drive cost efficiency while maintaining quality service delivery.
	Foster strong relationships with clients, partners, and vendors.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or related field.
	Strong leadership, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent knowledge of transport regulations, logistics software, and industry best practices.
	Ability to work under pressure and deliver results.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: antoni.hadesina@gmail.com using “Application – Experienced Transport and Logistics Manager" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Personnel",
  "description": "British International School (BIS) is a leading Nigerian International Secondary School, situated on a large purpose-built campus in the heart of one of Africa&#39;s liveliest cities. We offer a broad and balanced education to students aged between eleven and eighteen. The school is co-educational and accepts both day students and boarders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Personnel
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	A purpose-built campus situated in the heart of Lagos, hereby seek passionate, experienced and hardworking Tech expert to join the IT department.


Responsibilities
As an IT professional, you are expected to:&nbsp;


	Maintain organization&rsquo;s computer systems, networks and hardware to ensure smooth, efficient operations and security.
	Install, configure and maintain servers, operating systems, applications and other IT infrastructure.
	Monitor, analyze, and manage LANs, WANs and cloud platforms.
	Provide a safe and healthy environment and follow safeguarding procedures.
	Implement and manage IT security protocols to protect systems and data from threats and vulnerability.


Requirements


	Expertise in operating systems, networking, hardware, software applications and clouds platform.
	Effectively troubleshoot and resolve technical problems and system outage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV together with a formal application for the position, outlining their motivation for applying, the qualities and experience that they would bring to the role to:&nbsp;hr@bisnigeria.org&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	In addition, current CV must include full details of three professional referees, one of whom must be the applicant&rsquo;s current or most recent work place.
	Our school is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children.
	Qualified candidates only will be contacted and required to undergo background checks.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "The British International School"
    
  },

IT Personnel Job at British International School (BIS)




        
    

        
        British International School (BIS) is a leading Nigerian International Secondary School, situated on a large purpose-built campus in the heart of one of Africa's liveliest cities. We offer a broad and balanced education to students aged between eleven and eighteen. The school is co-educational and accepts both day students and boarders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Personnel
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	A purpose-built campus situated in the heart of Lagos, hereby seek passionate, experienced and hardworking Tech expert to join the IT department.


Responsibilities
As an IT professional, you are expected to: 


	Maintain organization’s computer systems, networks and hardware to ensure smooth, efficient operations and security.
	Install, configure and maintain servers, operating systems, applications and other IT infrastructure.
	Monitor, analyze, and manage LANs, WANs and cloud platforms.
	Provide a safe and healthy environment and follow safeguarding procedures.
	Implement and manage IT security protocols to protect systems and data from threats and vulnerability.


Requirements


	Expertise in operating systems, networking, hardware, software applications and clouds platform.
	Effectively troubleshoot and resolve technical problems and system outage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV together with a formal application for the position, outlining their motivation for applying, the qualities and experience that they would bring to the role to: hr@bisnigeria.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	In addition, current CV must include full details of three professional referees, one of whom must be the applicant’s current or most recent work place.
	Our school is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children.
	Qualified candidates only will be contacted and required to undergo background checks.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Service Executive / Customer Relations Officer",
  "description": "PRP Consult is an outsourcing firm, we are into recruitment and man power services. We source and attract suitable candidates for graduate and executive positions for our Clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Executive / Customer Relations Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ipaja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are currently seeking a well-experienced Customer Service Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate must have a flair for marketing, possess excellent communication skills, and a great personality that can represent the company in a positive light.


Responsibilities


	Handle customer inquiries and resolve complaints efficiently
	Build and maintain strong customer relationships
	Support the sales/marketing team when needed
	Represent the company professionally in all interactions
	Respond promptly to customer orders and inquiries.
	Communicate with customers through various channels.
	Acknowledge and resolve customers&rsquo; complaints.
	Know the company&rsquo;s products inside and out so that he/she can answer questions.
	Process orders, forms, and requests.
	Monitor different depots of the Company to ensure they do not run out of stock.
	Keep records of customers&rsquo; interactions, transactions, comments and complaints.
	Communicate and coordinate with colleagues as necessary.
	Maintain a positive, empathetic, and professional attitude toward customers at all times.
	Provide feedback on the efficiency of the customer service process.
	Manage and arrange thedistribution of our products to customers.
	Ensure customer satisfaction and provide professional customer support.
	Coordinate sales efforts with team members and other departments
	Analyse the territory/market&rsquo;s potential, track sales, and status reports
	Present, promote, and sell products using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
	Reach out to customer leads through cold calling
	Achieve agreed-upon sales targets and outcomes within the schedule


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Customer Service or related role
	Excellent spoken and written English
	Strong interpersonal and persuasive communication skills
	A flair for marketing and relationship management
	Confidence, smart appearance, and a positive attitude
	Ability to multitask and handle pressure professionally.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;prpconsult1@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Customer Service Executive / Customer Relations Officer&quot; as the subject of the of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-17",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "PRP Consult"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {

Customer Service Executive / Customer Relations Officer Job at PRP Consult




        
    

        
        PRP Consult is an outsourcing firm, we are into recruitment and man power services. We source and attract suitable candidates for graduate and executive positions for our Clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Executive / Customer Relations Officer
Job Location: Ipaja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are currently seeking a well-experienced Customer Service Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate must have a flair for marketing, possess excellent communication skills, and a great personality that can represent the company in a positive light.


Responsibilities


	Handle customer inquiries and resolve complaints efficiently
	Build and maintain strong customer relationships
	Support the sales/marketing team when needed
	Represent the company professionally in all interactions
	Respond promptly to customer orders and inquiries.
	Communicate with customers through various channels.
	Acknowledge and resolve customers’ complaints.
	Know the company’s products inside and out so that he/she can answer questions.
	Process orders, forms, and requests.
	Monitor different depots of the Company to ensure they do not run out of stock.
	Keep records of customers’ interactions, transactions, comments and complaints.
	Communicate and coordinate with colleagues as necessary.
	Maintain a positive, empathetic, and professional attitude toward customers at all times.
	Provide feedback on the efficiency of the customer service process.
	Manage and arrange thedistribution of our products to customers.
	Ensure customer satisfaction and provide professional customer support.
	Coordinate sales efforts with team members and other departments
	Analyse the territory/market’s potential, track sales, and status reports
	Present, promote, and sell products using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
	Reach out to customer leads through cold calling
	Achieve agreed-upon sales targets and outcomes within the schedule


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Customer Service or related role
	Excellent spoken and written English
	Strong interpersonal and persuasive communication skills
	A flair for marketing and relationship management
	Confidence, smart appearance, and a positive attitude
	Ability to multitask and handle pressure professionally.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: prpconsult1@gmail.com using "Customer Service Executive / Customer Relations Officer" as the subject of the of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Compliance Officer",
  "description": "JEV Consulting - Our client, one of the major players in the logistics industry, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Compliance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Magodo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking to hire a Compliance Officer&nbsp;for immediate employment. Proximity to the location will be an advantage. Candidates living at Magodo, Ojota, Ketu, Berger and its environs will be considered.


Responsibilities
Regulatory Compliance:


	Monitor compliance with local, regional, and international regulations governing logistics and transportation.
	Ensure compliance with customs, trade, safety, data protection, and environmental regulations.
	Keep up to date with changing laws and regulations that may impact operations.


Policy Development &amp; Enforcement:


	Develop, review, and update compliance policies, procedures, and guidelines.
	Ensure employees understand and follow company policies through communication and training.


Risk Assessment &amp; Monitoring:


	Conduct regular risk assessments on operational, financial, and reputational risks.
	Implement monitoring and auditing mechanisms to identify non-compliance or control weaknesses.
	Recommend corrective measures and follow up on implementation.


Reporting &amp; Investigations:


	Prepare compliance reports for management and regulatory authorities.
	Investigate compliance breaches, misconduct, or regulatory violations.
	Document findings and recommend disciplinary or corrective actions.


Training &amp; Awareness:


	Develop and deliver training sessions to employees on compliance topics such as anti-bribery, health &amp; safety, data protection, and ethical conduct.
	Promote a culture of compliance and accountability across departments.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Liaise with regulators, auditors, and external partners during inspections or audits.
	Collaborate with internal departments (e.g., operations, finance, HR, IT) to ensure compliance practices are integrated into business processes.


Qualifications


	National Diploma/NCE, Business Administration, Risk Management, Logistics, or related field.
	Professional certification in compliance, auditing, or risk management (e.g., ICA, CCEP, ISO Compliance, ACAMS) is desirable.
	B.Sc/HND with 1 year experience will be added advantage.


Experience


	Minimum 1&ndash;2 years of experience in compliance, audit, or risk management.
	Previous experience in logistics, supply chain, transportation, or freight forwarding sector preferred.
	Experience dealing with regulatory authorities, audits, or investigations.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	In-depth knowledge of compliance requirements in logistics, including customs, anti-money laundering (AML), anti-bribery, safety, and data protection.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and report-writing abilities.
	Ability to influence stakeholders and promote compliance culture.
	Sound judgment, integrity, and attention to detail.
	Proficiency in compliance monitoring tools and Microsoft Office applications.


Personal Attributes:


	Ethical and principled, with strong professional integrity.
	Proactive, detail-oriented, and results-driven.
	Able to work independently and under pressure.
	Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate across diverse teams.
	Resilient, adaptable, and able to handle sensitive issues discreetly.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@jevconsulting.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-31",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Compliance Officer Job at JEV Consulting




        
    

        
        JEV Consulting - Our client, one of the major players in the logistics industry, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Officer

Job Location: Magodo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking to hire a Compliance Officer for immediate employment. Proximity to the location will be an advantage. Candidates living at Magodo, Ojota, Ketu, Berger and its environs will be considered.


Responsibilities
Regulatory Compliance:
     

            
    




	Monitor compliance with local, regional, and international regulations governing logistics and transportation.
	Ensure compliance with customs, trade, safety, data protection, and environmental regulations.
	Keep up to date with changing laws and regulations that may impact operations.


Policy Development & Enforcement:


	Develop, review, and update compliance policies, procedures, and guidelines.
	Ensure employees understand and follow company policies through communication and training.


Risk Assessment & Monitoring:


	Conduct regular risk assessments on operational, financial, and reputational risks.
	Implement monitoring and auditing mechanisms to identify non-compliance or control weaknesses.
	Recommend corrective measures and follow up on implementation.


Reporting & Investigations:


	Prepare compliance reports for management and regulatory authorities.
	Investigate compliance breaches, misconduct, or regulatory violations.
	Document findings and recommend disciplinary or corrective actions.


Training & Awareness:


	Develop and deliver training sessions to employees on compliance topics such as anti-bribery, health & safety, data protection, and ethical conduct.
	Promote a culture of compliance and accountability across departments.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Liaise with regulators, auditors, and external partners during inspections or audits.
	Collaborate with internal departments (e.g., operations, finance, HR, IT) to ensure compliance practices are integrated into business processes.


Qualifications


	National Diploma/NCE, Business Administration, Risk Management, Logistics, or related field.
	Professional certification in compliance, auditing, or risk management (e.g., ICA, CCEP, ISO Compliance, ACAMS) is desirable.
	B.Sc/HND with 1 year experience will be added advantage.


Experience


	Minimum 1–2 years of experience in compliance, audit, or risk management.
	Previous experience in logistics, supply chain, transportation, or freight forwarding sector preferred.
	Experience dealing with regulatory authorities, audits, or investigations.


Skills & Competencies:


	In-depth knowledge of compliance requirements in logistics, including customs, anti-money laundering (AML), anti-bribery, safety, and data protection.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and report-writing abilities.
	Ability to influence stakeholders and promote compliance culture.
	Sound judgment, integrity, and attention to detail.
	Proficiency in compliance monitoring tools and Microsoft Office applications.


Personal Attributes:


	Ethical and principled, with strong professional integrity.
	Proactive, detail-oriented, and results-driven.
	Able to work independently and under pressure.
	Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate across diverse teams.
	Resilient, adaptable, and able to handle sensitive issues discreetly.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@jevconsulting.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Risk Compliance Officer",
  "description": "At Strivo Labs, we are passionate about helping businesses scale with speed and precision. We specialise in providing end-to-end digital solutions, from custom design and MVP development to automation and content creation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Risk Compliance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

About the Job


	At Strivo Labs, we are building digital products that transform financial services and e-commerce.
	To maintain trust, security, and regulatory excellence, we are hiring a Risk &amp; Compliance Officer who will safeguard our operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and proactively manage risks.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement risk management and compliance frameworks tailored to financial services and e-commerce operations.
	Identify, assess, and monitor business, financial, operational, and regulatory risks.
	Ensure compliance with NDPR, GDPR, CBN regulations, PCI-DSS, AML/CFT laws, and other relevant standards.
	Conduct regular audits and compliance reviews across departments.
	Liaise with regulators, auditors, and legal teams on compliance matters.
	Investigate compliance breaches, design corrective actions, and enforce accountability.
	Provide staff training and awareness programs on compliance and risk management.
	Prepare regular risk and compliance reports for management and the board.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Law, Finance, Risk Management, or related field.
	Minimum 5 years of experience in risk &amp; compliance within financial services and/or e-commerce.
	Professional certifications such as CRISC, CAMS, ISO 31000, CISA, or Compliance certifications are an advantage.
	Strong understanding of regulatory requirements in Nigeria and international standards
	Excellent analytical, investigative, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication and stakeholder management abilities.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits.
	Opportunity to shape risk and compliance practices in a fast-scaling fintech and e-commerce company.
	Professional development and certification support.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, salary expectation, and cover letter&nbsp;to:&nbsp;hiring@strivolabs.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Application &ndash; Risk &amp; Compliance Officer&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-17",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Strivo Labs"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }

Risk Compliance Officer Job at Strivo Labs




        
    

        
        At Strivo Labs, we are passionate about helping businesses scale with speed and precision. We specialise in providing end-to-end digital solutions, from custom design and MVP development to automation and content creation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Risk Compliance Officer

Job Location: Nigeria

About the Job
     

            
    




	At Strivo Labs, we are building digital products that transform financial services and e-commerce.
	To maintain trust, security, and regulatory excellence, we are hiring a Risk & Compliance Officer who will safeguard our operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and proactively manage risks.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement risk management and compliance frameworks tailored to financial services and e-commerce operations.
	Identify, assess, and monitor business, financial, operational, and regulatory risks.
	Ensure compliance with NDPR, GDPR, CBN regulations, PCI-DSS, AML/CFT laws, and other relevant standards.
	Conduct regular audits and compliance reviews across departments.
	Liaise with regulators, auditors, and legal teams on compliance matters.
	Investigate compliance breaches, design corrective actions, and enforce accountability.
	Provide staff training and awareness programs on compliance and risk management.
	Prepare regular risk and compliance reports for management and the board.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Law, Finance, Risk Management, or related field.
	Minimum 5 years of experience in risk & compliance within financial services and/or e-commerce.
	Professional certifications such as CRISC, CAMS, ISO 31000, CISA, or Compliance certifications are an advantage.
	Strong understanding of regulatory requirements in Nigeria and international standards
	Excellent analytical, investigative, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication and stakeholder management abilities.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits.
	Opportunity to shape risk and compliance practices in a fast-scaling fintech and e-commerce company.
	Professional development and certification support.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, salary expectation, and cover letter to: hiring@strivolabs.com using “Application – Risk & Compliance Officer” as the subject of the email.
